author: halfinney.
content: Hey <@552133098075193354> , what do you think are the chances that 1559 is not ready by the time the London HF needs to rollout?

author: timbeiko
content: It could happen, but I think it's extremely unlikely

author: timbeiko
content: I think the way to make sure it happens is to not add anything else to London until 1559 is ready

author: halfinney.
content: thanks Tim

author: halfinney.
content: btw was curious to know what the plan would be if it does not get implemented? I asked Micah this before and he wasnâ€™t sure about it

author: abdel.stark
content: just want to make sure we have consensus between Geth and Besu before sharing those tests. Because we are currently working on transaction encoding / decoding

author: abdel.stark
content: once we have consensus between Geth and Besu <@!524738020033691659> will be able to provide tests for tx hashes and signatures

author: jochembrouwer
content: Great - I will wait for these test to ensure we are correct as well ðŸ™‚

author: marekm3498
content: Is there any plan for EIPs that defines how new transactions will be sent by RPC? I know that we have sendRawTransaction. However, are we planning to modify sendTransaction also?

author: marekm3498
content: What is the correct RLP for the new transaction type? I see that the client implementations have a different order than documentation. Documentation transaction payload RLP is: rlp([chainId, nonce, maxInclusionFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS]). What is in the client implementations is: [nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, maxInclusionFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS].

author: sky.cactus
content: Which client implementation are you looking at?

author: marekm3498
content:
https://github.com/vulcanize/go-ethereum-EIP1559/blob/master/core/types/transaction.go#L162
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/master/ethereum/core/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/core/encoding/TransactionDecoder.java#L174

author: abdel.stark
content: The go implementation is obsolete

author: abdel.stark
content: Go implementation is:

author: abdel.stark
content: https://github.com/quilt/go-ethereum/tree/eip1559

author: abdel.stark
content: Latest Besu version: https://github.com/abdelhamidbakhta/besu/tree/playground

author: marekm3498
content: <@!574864862338088960> thx, now it's clear for me

author: timbeiko
content: Well, it depends: if it's a slight delay, then the difficulty bomb will go off and we'll deploy shortly after, which is not great. If it's a massive delay we could split London and remove the difficulty bomb, but that's very unlikely.

author: halfinney.
content: thanks for the reply! makes sense now
